item.title: Dragos Says No Evidence of Breach After Ransomware Gang Claims Hack via Third Party
item.content:encoded:
evidence, data breach, BlackCat ransomware group, security firm, third party Summary: The security firm Dragos has found no evidence of a data breach after the BlackCat ransomware group claimed to have hacked the company via a third party. This news comes as a relief for the security firm and its clients, as a data breach could have serious consequences. The claim made by the BlackCat ransomware group had initially raised concerns about the security of the firm's systems and the potential exposure of sensitive information. However, Dragos has conducted a thorough investigation and found no indication that their systems were compromised. This development underscores the importance of robust security measures and proactive monitoring to safeguard against cyber threats. Additionally, it highlights the need for organizations to stay vigilant and responsive in the face of potential security incidents. Overall, Dragos' findings provide reassurance to both the company and its clients, demonstrating the effectiveness of their security protocols in fending off external cyber attacks.

Summary:

Dragos finds no evidence of a data breach after the BlackCat ransomware group claimed to have hacked the security firm via a third party.

The post Dragos Says No Evidence of Breach After Ransomware Gang Claims Hack via Third Party appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ransomware Group RansomedVC Closes Shop
item.content:encoded:
Ransomware, data extortion, RansomedVC, shut down, sell
Summary:
The ransomware and data extortion group RansomedVC has announced its plan to shut down the project and sell parts of its infrastructure. This decision comes after the group has been involved in various cybercrimes. RansomedVC is known for attacking organizations and extorting money by encrypting their data and demanding payments in return for decryption keys. The group's actions have caused significant financial losses and disruptions to businesses and institutions. By selling off its infrastructure, RansomedVC aims to potentially transfer its operations to other threat actors. This move raises concerns about the potential impact on the cybersecurity landscape as other malicious groups could acquire and repurpose the infrastructure for their own illicit activities. It is essential for organizations and law enforcement agencies to remain vigilant and take proactive measures to combat such cyber threats.

The ransomware and data extortion group RansomedVC announced plans to shut down the project and sell parts of its infrastructure.

The post Ransomware Group RansomedVC Closes Shop appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 2.2 Million Impacted by Data Breach at McLaren Health Care
item.content:encoded:
health care, McLaren, data breach, personal information, individuals Summary: McLaren Health Care is notifying about 2.2 million people about a data breach that has affected their personal information. The breach has led to unauthorized access to sensitive data, including names, addresses, dates of birth, and Social Security numbers. McLaren has stated that it is working with law enforcement and cybersecurity experts to investigate the breach and has implemented additional security measures to prevent future incidents. The organization is also offering free credit monitoring and identity protection services to those affected. McLaren Health Care has apologized for the breach and is taking steps to improve its data security protocols to prevent similar incidents in the future. The affected individuals are being urged to remain vigilant and monitor their financial accounts for any suspicious activity.

McLaren Health Care is informing roughly 2.2 million individuals of a data breach impacting their personal information.

The post 2.2 Million Impacted by Data Breach at McLaren Health Care appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ransomware Group Leaks Files Allegedly Stolen From Boeing
item.content:encoded:
The LockBit ransomware group has leaked gigabytes of files allegedly stolen from the systems of aerospace giant Boeing. 

The post Ransomware Group Leaks Files Allegedly Stolen From Boeing appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mr. Cooper Says Customer Data Compromised in Cyberattack
item.content:encoded:
US mortgage giant Mr. Cooper announced that customer data was compromised in an October 31 cyberattack.

item.title: Operations at Major Australian Ports Significantly Disrupted by Cyberattack
item.content:encoded:
A cyberattack on Australian shipping giant DP World, which may have been a ransomware attack, has resulted in serious disruptions at major ports.

The post Operations at Major Australian Ports Significantly Disrupted by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Yellen Says Ransomware Attack on China’s Biggest Bank Minimally Disrupted Treasury Market Trades
item.content:encoded:
A ransomware attack that forced China’s biggest bank to take some systems offline only minimally disrupted the U.S. Treasury market.

The post Yellen Says Ransomware Attack on China’s Biggest Bank Minimally Disrupted Treasury Market Trades appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cavelo Raises CA$5 Million for Attack Surface Management Platform
item.content:encoded:
Cavelo has raised CA$5 million (~US$3.6 million USD) to help organizations comply with data protection regulations.

item.title: Intel Sued Over ‘Downfall’ CPU Vulnerability
item.content:encoded:
A class action lawsuit has been filed against Intel over its handling of CPU speculative execution vulnerabilities, with a focus on Downfall.

The post Intel Sued Over ‘Downfall’ CPU Vulnerability  appeared first on SecurityWeek.
